meanings.definition: Either of two small masses of lymphoid tissue situated one on each side of the throat.
meanings.sent1: The tonsil on the left side of my throat was swollen.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined my tonsils during the check-up.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my tonsils were like little guards protecting my throat.
meanings.sent4: Her tonsils were like tiny soldiers fighting off infections.
meanings.sent5: The tonsil, like a shield, defended my body from harmful germs.

meanings.definition: A similar mass of tissue at the base of the tongue.
meanings.sent1: The tonsil at the base of the tongue can sometimes cause discomfort.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon removed the tonsil near the tongue to relieve the patient's symptoms.
meanings.sent3: He compared the tonsil near the tongue to a hidden treasure in the mouth.
meanings.sent4: The tonsil by the tongue whispered secrets only the dentist could understand.
meanings.sent5: The tonsil near the tongue, like a silent guardian, watched over the mouth.
